item.title: Testing the Ground: Reflections on 2024 and the Road Ahead for 2025
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: As we bid farewell to 2024 and welcome 2025, it’s a time to reflect on the lessons learned, both good and challenging, and prepare for the opportunities ahead. Not everything went as planned, but each experience has been a stepping stone toward growth. Intelligence, after all, evolves through adaptation, and 2024 was undeniably a year where Artificial Intelligence (AI) took center stage. Looking ahead, 2025 promises to bring more focused implementation, balancing AI advancements with broader digital modernization efforts.

item.title: Guest Lecture: AI and Metaverse reshaping the future
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: AI is pervasive, whether we sense it or not. Staying updated has become essential for survival. We are increasingly immersed in artificially generated worlds, with the internet rapidly evolving into what is known as the metaverse. In my book, “Exploring the Metaverse”, I delve into its various forms and interpretations, usecases and challenges, and the way forward. DesignersX, a company specializing in software development, invited me to speak about my book and discuss how AI and the metaverse will shape the future.

item.title: Foundational shifts: Reflecting on 2023 and anticipating ahead
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: As we say goodbye to 2023 and welcome 2024, it’s a time to think about the good and tough parts of the year. Not everything goes the way we want, but we can learn from both the good and bad experiences. I see 2023 as a year of making things better, like fixing the base of a building. I’ve picked my top five observations on foundational changes from this year, and some might continue into 2024.

item.title: My thoughtworkings from five thoughtful years
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Thoughtworks is celebrating its 30th year in industry, and I have completed five years here, and to celebrate this, I have compiled thoughts from thoughtworkers, and published them as an ebook. I am grateful for the wealth of knowledge and experiences shared by my colleagues. These thoughts have resonated with me and shaped my journey within the organization and life. I am excited to launch the ebook with this post. I believe this compilation of thoughts will not only serve as a personal reflection but also as a valuable resource for others on their own professional journeys.

item.title: Two Thoughtful Years!
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: It‚Äôs now two years since I accepted a challenging change to leave the previous organization after 13 long years, and join ThoughtWorks. Any change requires sacrifices and dedication before it becomes a positive change, but the journey becomes easy when we believe in the change and accept it.
